trans-unit.source: Retrieves the handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match

target.mrk: Retrieves the handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match

trans-unit.source: A string that specifies the class name or is an atom that identifies the class-name string.

seg-source.mrk: A string that specifies the class name or is an atom that identifies the class-name string.

target.mrk: A string that specifies the class name or is an atom that identifies the class-name string.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is an atom, it must be a global atom created by a call to the GlobalAddAtom function.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is an atom, it must be a global atom created by a call to the GlobalAddAtom function.

target.mrk: If this parameter is an atom, it must be a global atom created by a call to the GlobalAddAtom function.

trans-unit.source: The atom, a 16-bit value, must be placed in the low-order word of the $sClassName string and the high-order word must be zero.

seg-source.mrk: The atom, a 16-bit value, must be placed in the low-order word of the $sClassName string and the high-order word must be zero.

target.mrk: The atom, a 16-bit value, must be placed in the low-order word of the $sClassName string and the high-order word must be zero.

trans-unit.source: A string that specifies the window name. If this parameter is blank, all window names match.

seg-source.mrk: A string that specifies the window name.
If this parameter is blank, all window names match.

target.mrk: A string that specifies the window name.
If this parameter is blank, all window names match.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information
